articles.title: 'Shocking event': Commentator reacts to possible shooting of former Japanese PM - CNN Video
articles.description: Former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe has been rushed to hospital following a possible shooting during a speech in Nara, Japan, public broadcaster NHK reports. CNN's Global Affairs Analyst Susan Glasser has more.

articles.title: Video: Shinzo Abe collapses after suspected shooting - CNN Video
articles.description: Former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe was rushed to hospital after possible shooting, NHK reports.

articles.author: Helen Regan, Junko Ogura and Emiko Jozuka, CNN
articles.title: Former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe rushed to hospital after possible shooting, NHK reports
articles.description: Former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe has been rushed to hospital following a possible shooting during a speech in Nara, Japan, public broadcaster NHK reports.

articles.author: Raja Razek, CNN
articles.title: Woman accused of killing elite cyclist used passport that belonged to someone 'closely associated' with her to flee to Costa Rica, authorities say
articles.description: The woman who fled to Costa Rica after allegedly killing an elite cyclist in Texas used several aliases and a passport that belongs to someone "closely associated with her," a spokesperson for the US Marshals Service said Thursday.

articles.title: Analysis: Jan. 6 committee gets its most important witness yet as Trump White House counsel testifies
articles.description: The House select committee investigating the US Capitol insurrection on Friday could land some of its most critical testimony yet -- from former White House Counsel Pat Cipollone, who was present for some of the most fraught moments in Donald Trump's West Win…

articles.author: By Jessie Yeung and Helen Regan, CNN
articles.title: Live updates: Shinzo Abe hospitalized after possible shooting in Japan
articles.description: Shinzo Abe, the former Prime Minister of Japan, was rushed to the hospital on Friday afternoon after a possible shooting during a speech in the city of Nara, according to public broadcaster NHK.
articles.content:
Shinzo Abe was the longest-serving Japanese Prime Minister in history before he stepped down in 2020, citing health reasons. 
Abe has colitis, a non-curable inflammatory bowel disease, which was als… [+673 chars]

articles.author: By Jessie Yeung and Helen Regan, CNN
articles.title: Live updates: Shinzo Abe hospitalized after shooting in Japan
articles.description: Former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe has been rushed to hospital after he was shot in the chest during a speech in Nara, Japan, public broadcaster NHK reported, citing an official of the Liberal Democratic Party Abe faction.
articles.content:
The shooting of Shinzo Abe has shocked Japan, which has one of the lowest rates of gun crime in the world due to its extremely strict gun control laws. 
In 2018, Japan only reported nine deaths from… [+1092 chars]

articles.author: By Jessie Yeung and Helen Regan, CNN
articles.title: Live updates: Shinzo Abe hospitalized after possible shooting in Japan
articles.description: Shinzo Abe, the former Prime Minister of Japan, was rushed to the hospital on Friday afternoon after a possible shooting during a speech in the city of Nara, according to public broadcaster NHK.
articles.content:
Shinzo Abe collapsed during a speech in Nara City at around 11:30 a.m. local time, and appeared to be bleeding after a possible gunshot in his back, according to Japans public broadcaster NHK.

articles.title: An 8-year-old boy is paralyzed from the waist down after getting shot in the chest in Highland Park parade attack
articles.description: An 8-year-old boy who was attending the Highland Park Fourth of July parade with his parents and twin brother was shot and is now paralyzed from the waist down, family spokesperson Anthony Loizzi told CNN on Thursday.

articles.author: Analysis by Mark Thompson, CNN Business
articles.title: Analysis: Boris Johnson leaves world's fifth biggest economy in crisis
articles.description: Boris Johnson was ultimately forced to resign as UK prime minister Thursday as dozens of members of his party quit the government after one ethics scandal too many.
